title: 28 Years Later: The Bone Temple
synopsis: The sequel to the post-apocalyptic horror film continues the story 28 years after the rage virus outbreak. A new generation of survivors must face evolved infected creatures while uncovering the secrets of a mysterious temple that may hold the key to humanity's future.

title: A Private Life
synopsis: A French drama about a woman who decides to live her life completely in private, away from social media and public scrutiny. As she attempts to maintain her anonymity in an increasingly connected world, she discovers both the freedom and isolation that privacy brings.

title: Arco
synopsis: A French drama set in a small coastal town where a young man returns home after years away. As he reconnects with his past and the people he left behind, he must confront unresolved conflicts and decide whether to stay or leave again.

title: Avatar: Fire and Ash
synopsis: The third installment in James Cameron's Avatar saga follows Jake Sully and his family as they face a new threat from the fire tribes of Pandora. With the Na'vi world in danger, they must unite different clans and harness the power of fire to protect their home and way of life.

title: Breathless
synopsis: Jean-Luc Godard's classic French New Wave film follows a small-time thief who steals a car and kills a policeman, then tries to persuade his American girlfriend to flee with him to Italy. A landmark of cinema that revolutionized filmmaking with its innovative techniques.

title: Crime 101
synopsis: An elusive thief, eyeing his final score, encounters a disillusioned insurance broker at her own crossroads. As their paths intertwine, a relentless detective trails them hoping to thwart the multi-million dollar heist they are planning.

title: Father Mother Sister Brother
synopsis: A family drama that explores the complex relationships between four siblings as they reunite for their father's funeral. Old wounds are reopened and long-buried secrets are revealed as they navigate grief, forgiveness, and the bonds that tie families together.

title: GOAT
synopsis: A small goat with big dreams gets a once-in-a-lifetime shot to join the pros and play roarball, a high-intensity, co-ed, full-contact sport dominated by the fastest, fiercest animals in the world.

title: Hamnet
synopsis: Based on Maggie O'Farrell's novel, this drama tells the story of Hamnet, Shakespeare's son, whose death at age 11 profoundly affected the playwright and inspired him to write his masterpiece 'Hamlet'. The film explores grief, family, and the creative process.

title: It Was Just an Accident
synopsis: An Iranian drama about a tragic accident that changes the lives of everyone involved. The film explores themes of guilt, responsibility, and forgiveness as the characters grapple with the consequences of a single moment that altered their destinies forever.

title: Left-Handed Girl
synopsis: A coming-of-age story about a young left-handed girl who struggles to find her place in a traditional society that views her difference as a curse. Through determination and self-discovery, she learns to embrace her uniqueness and challenge societal expectations.

title: Marty Supreme
synopsis: Marty Mauser, a young man with a dream no one respects, goes to hell and back in pursuit of greatness. In 1952 New York, Marty is determined to prove himself as the world's best table tennis player, but his self-absorbed ambitions and reckless choices threaten to derail his quest for recognition and success.

title: No Other Choice
synopsis: After being fired, a man devises a unique plan to secure a new job: eliminate his competition.

title: Nouvelle Vague
synopsis: A meta-cinematic exploration of French New Wave cinema, following a group of filmmakers as they attempt to recreate the revolutionary spirit of 1960s French cinema while grappling with modern filmmaking challenges and artistic integrity.

title: Nuremberg
synopsis: A historical drama about the Nuremberg Trials following World War II, focusing on the legal proceedings that brought Nazi war criminals to justice. The film explores themes of justice, accountability, and the challenge of prosecuting crimes against humanity.

title: One Battle After Another
synopsis: An action drama about a warrior who must face a series of increasingly difficult battles to protect his homeland. Each conflict tests not only his physical abilities but also his moral convictions as he struggles to maintain his humanity in the face of endless warfare.

title: Primate
synopsis: A group of friends' tropical vacation turns into a terrifying, primal tale of horror and survival.

title: Rental Family
synopsis: A Japanese drama about a man who works for a company that provides rental family members to clients who need temporary relatives for various occasions. As he takes on different family roles, he begins to question the nature of authentic relationships and family bonds.

title: Return to Silent Hill
synopsis: Based on the popular video game series, this horror film follows a man searching for his missing wife in the fog-shrouded town of Silent Hill. As he delves deeper into the town's dark secrets, he must confront nightmarish creatures and his own past.

title: Send Help
synopsis: A comedy-drama about a group of friends who find themselves stranded in a remote location and must rely on each other to survive. As they wait for rescue, they confront their relationships, personal demons, and what it truly means to help one another.

title: Sentimental Value
synopsis: A Norwegian drama about family heirlooms and the emotional weight they carry across generations. When a family must decide what to do with their inherited possessions, they confront memories, relationships, and the true meaning of sentimental value.

title: Stray Kids: The dominATE Experience
synopsis: Captures the K-pop group's sold-out performances at Los Angeles' SoFi Stadium, combining concert footage from Stray Kids' dominATE world tour with behind-the-scenes material.

title: The Housemaid
synopsis: A psychological thriller starring Sydney Sweeney as a young woman who takes a job as a housemaid for a wealthy family. As she becomes increasingly involved in their lives, she discovers dark secrets that put her own safety at risk.

title: The President's Cake
synopsis: In 1990s Iraq, 9-year-old Lamia must bake the President's birthday cake. She scrambles to find ingredients for this compulsory task while facing potential punishment if she fails.

title: The Rose: Come back to me
originalTitle: The Rose: Come back to me
synopsis: An intimate documentary chronicling the remarkable journey of The Rose - from their humble beginnings as a South Korean indie band to their rise as a global sensation.

title: Three Goodbyes
synopsis: After what seemed like a trivial argument, Marta and Antonio separate. He retreats to his kitchen; she, in her silence, begins to notice something more than sadness: she has lost her appetite, and not just because of heartbreak. When she discovers an underlying health issue, everything takes an unexpected turn: food tastes better, music moves her like never before, and desire awakens her will to live.

title: Toujours possible
synopsis: At 55, biologist Gaby loses her job and gets a crazy idea: having a baby. With her eccentric mother and a donor database, she hunts for perfect sperm, while Pierre, 56, tries desperately to look younger to attract.

title: Wuthering Heights
synopsis: A passionate and tumultuous love story set against the backdrop of the Yorkshire moors, exploring the intense and destructive relationship between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

title: Zootopia 2
synopsis: The sequel to Disney's hit animated film follows Judy Hopps and Nick Wilde as they face a new challenge in Zootopia. When a mysterious threat emerges that could divide the animal metropolis, the unlikely partners must work together to restore harmony and unity.
